Facsimile Images

[δι]ὰ το̄̀ς θεο̄̀ς το̄́[σ]δε νικο͂ντι τοὶ Σελινο̄́ν [τιοι]
[δι]ὰ τὸν Δία νικο͂μες καὶ διὰ τὸν Φόβον [καὶ]
[δ]ιὰ hερακλέα καὶ δι’ Ἀπόλλο̄να καὶ διὰ Π[οτ-]
ει[δᾶ]να καὶ διὰ Τυνδαρίδας καὶ δι᾿ Ἀθ[α-]
5ναίαν καὶ διὰ Μ[α]λοφόρον καὶ διὰ Πασι[κ-]
ρά[τ]ειαν καὶ διὰ το̄̀ς ἄλλο̄ς θεο̄̀ς διὰ δ[ὲ] Δία
μάλιστα φιλία[ς] δὲ γενομένας ἐν χ[ρ]υσ-
έο̄ι ἐλά[με]ν τὰ [δ᾿ ἔτι] ὀνύματα ταῦτα κολ-
άψαντ[ες εἰς τ]ὸ [Ἀπο]λλο̄́νιον κάθθεμε-
10ν τὸ Διὸ[ς προ]γρά[ψα]ντες τὸ δὲ χρυσίον
<h>εξε̄́κ[οντα τ]αλάντο̄ν ἐ͂μεν

Apparatus criticus

Text of IGPalermo

English translation

It is through the gods listed here that the Selinuntines win victory. Through Zeus we conquer and through Phobos and through Herakles and through Apollo and through Poseidon and through the Tyndaridai and through Athena and through Malophoros and through Pasikrateia and through the other gods, but through Zeus above all. Since there is friendship (it is resolved), that having forged in gold, and having engraved these names, to dedicate in the Apollonion, having written the name of Zeus in first place; and that the gold be sixty talents.

commentary

English translation

It is through the gods listed here that the Selinuntines win victory. Through Zeus we conquer and through Phobos and through Herakles and through Apollo and through Poseidon and through the Tyndaridai and through Athena and through Malophoros and through Pasikrateia and through the other gods, but through Zeus above all. Since there is friendship (it is resolved), that having forged in gold, and having engraved these names, to dedicate in the Apollonion, having written the name of Zeus in first place; and that the gold be sixty talents.
